name: Nantasket Hotel at the Beach

reviews.title: Nice Place
reviews.text: We stayed here for two nights over the weekend. Very friendly check in. More than spacious room which was clean and well appointed. Price was right. Nice view of ocean through back door/porch. adequate free parking. Would definitely stay here again.

reviews.title: one of the best
reviews.text: we booked a family room through booking.com when I saw the "excellent" rating, and I was surprised since most of the low to mid budget motels/hotels we have used on our 3-month USA road trip get "satisfactory" at best.

reviews.title: Adequate
reviews.text: Nantasket Hotel lives up to its reputation - the room was huge and felt brand new, the manager was very helpful and welcoming, and the huge beds and sheets feel like they should be in a $400/night luxury resort!

reviews.title: More a motel than a hotel.
reviews.text: Excellent location, right on the beach, but the best part was the price - we paid the same we have been paying elsewhere for very cheap and bland chain motels beside interstates. Its nice to have luxury break on a budget!

reviews.title: Great
reviews.text: Rooms are clean and comfortable, but given the "closed season" for the resort, perhaps a little over priced for during the week. Curtains are more an accessory rather than functional, raising concerns about privacy when the people in the next room made a point of looking into our room when walking along the balcony outside.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 2 nights and thought it was a great little hotel across the street from the beach, within walking distances to most restaurants in the area, and very clean with updated rooms. I loved all the little touches like the complimentary snacks and bottles of water on arrival and the beautiful flowers all around the property. The owners have done a great job.
reviews.title: Nice little hotel across from the beach

reviews.text: This property makes the most of what is has. On the outside it has a standard motel layout, 2 levels of rooms with balconies with parking in the front.,,Standard stuff. But inside there is more then meets the eye!
reviews.title: Pride of ownership & updated facilities insures a great stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were larger then i expected with up graded furnishings throughout, and very comfortable bedding.
reviews.title: Felt like we were staying in someone's home

reviews.text: Staff was very accommodating at time of booking, and check-in.
reviews.title: And.....it's a big fat No

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom had nice toiletries, and modern facility upgrades, and much like the rest of the property...everything was a step up from what i had initially expected, from a beach side motel.
reviews.title: Exceeded Expectations!
Two weeks in Hull
reviews.text: My 16 year old daughter and I just got back to Florida after spending two great weeks at The Nantasket Hotel. The owner Paul, his dad Paul and all the staff were wonderful. The room was large, beautiful & clean. I left my jewelry sitting on the bureau one day and when I realized it I was a wreck until I got back. It was right where I left it. Great location as well. Would go back!!

reviews.title: Great hotel, great location
reviews.text: Stayed here for several days while visiting a friend in Hull. The hotel and and the staff are wonderful. The room was clean, nicely decorated, very spacious, and had many personal touches that made it feel more like home than a hotel. The thick soft decorative bath towels are a nice touch, and complimentary bottled water and snacks were welcomed after a long day of travel. Room has a minifridge and microwave. If you want a coffee maker, ask at the front desk and they will give you one, as these are not in the room. This is not a high end hotel with amenities on site, but rather a clean, comfy, relaxing hotel right across from the beach. And, restaurants within walking distance. Actually a nice change from the big hotels where you are just another person to fill a room. The service on the TV was a little quirky, but not a big deal when you are spending your day at the beach. The staff was wonderful. Dealt with several different people, all of which were extremely nice, and make you feel right at home. I would highly recommend this hotel!

reviews.title: Wonderful hotel!
reviews.text: Very pleasantly surprised by this motel. It was very clean, fresh, nicely decorated, quiet, very spacious! Loved everything about it! Made us feel right at home. Comfy beds, plush towels, mini fridge, microwave - they even welcomed us with complimentary bottled water and snacks when we arrived. No fancy amenities, but who needs them? You're on the beach! Location is excellent - a few steps to beach. Convenient, free parking. Great restaurants in walking distance. And the staff was exceptionally helpful and friendly. We had to make a last minute change to our reservation when we got there and Paul was fantastic about working with us. The owners clearly take pride in their property and it shows in every detail. I hope I have an opportunity to stay at Nantasket Hotel again, but in the meantime I will highly recommend it to anyone looking for a place to stay in Hull.

reviews.title: Great place to stay!
reviews.text: Chose this place on a whim! Ended up being a great choice! Very clean, up to date decor, and very roomy! Owner was very nice and helpful. Within walking distance to beach and restaurants. Would highly recommend it!!

reviews.title: Last minute getaway
reviews.text: I was leary to stay at this hotel because of it's past. Therefore, I was so pleasantly surprised @ how beautifully appointed it is now. The rooms are clean, staff is very helpful and extremely friendly. Slept with my windows open and it was so peaceful and quiet. I will be going back every week this summer. Probably in the winter, as well.

reviews.title: Good Inexpensive Place to Stay
reviews.text: If you want an inexpensive place to lay your head near the beach, this is it. Don't expect much more, though. The rooms have recently been renovated, so they are very clean and nicely decorated. I have seen reviews that mention private balconies - that's not here. Some of the booking sites say ocean view rooms - that's not here either. What you do get is very simple accommodations within walking distance of the beach. At times, it was very noisy, either because of traffic, airplanes, people coming and going in nearby rooms, or the wind whistling through the doors and windows. Oh, and the curtains don't fully cover the windows so don't do anything in your room that you don't want seen from outside, or at least get creative about how to fully cover the windows (I saw blankets, pillows, sheets, etc in other rooms). All in all, it's a decent place to stay on a dime, but I think when we return, we'll splurge a little for one of the places down the road.

reviews.title: Excellent Place!
reviews.text: Really enjoyed this lovely spot. Was here during the big New England Blizzard. The staff went all out to remove snow and make all walkways safe and passable. The rooms are nicely decorated and have a microwave and fridge. The front desk staff has been very responsive. Some bottles of water and chips in the room that are free which is nice. One thing that would be a good addition is to have some ceramic cups in the room with some teabags and instant coffee so you could have some coffee and/or tea. There is a Keurig machine in the lobby and muffins are served in the a.m. This hotel is within walking distance of the ocean which even in this harsh season is absolutely beautiful.

reviews.title: Spacious yet mediocre room.
reviews.text: The hotel has been remodeled yet the curtains were my main complaint. They are not wide enough to cover the window completely which is very frustrating since they face the walkway and main road. When you take into account busy season prices, this was such a big deal that it brought my rating down to two stars. The paint job in the rooms could be better. The rooms were clean and the location is great.

reviews.title: Didn't meet our expectations
reviews.text: We booked in here partly based on all the enthusiasm from TripAdvisor reviewers. But this was strictly a get-what-you-pay-for experience. Yes, the price was low. Yes, the walls were thin (you could hear your neighbors' conversations) and the curtains didn't fully cover the windows.

reviews.title: Great place to stay!
reviews.text: There is no management on-property at night, so we were on our own to solve problems as they arose. They honored my request for a coffeemaker, but they didn't supply it with coffee.

description: Nantasket Hotel has been completely renovated from 2009-2010... All of our rooms offer private baths, King or Queen beds, plasma TVs, Free wireless internet... Located directly across from 3 mile long Historic Nantasket Beach... Close to the boardwalk offering all kinds of restaurants and entertainment!
